definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
Diary of a Madman by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4]

sentences.english: The books and journal were informative.
sentences.chinese: 那些書和日記信息量很足。

sentences.english: The newly discovered notes are nothing more than Jack's personal journal.
sentences.chinese: 新發現的筆記只不過是傑克的個人日記。

sentences.english: When you have a realization, write it down in your journal.
sentences.chinese: 當你有所領悟時，把它們記在你的日記裏。

sentences.english: What will you see in the Orwell diaries?
sentences.chinese: 從奧威爾的日記裏，我們能看到什麼？

sentences.english: Two weeks later , Lily returned to school . If you were Lily , write a diary .
sentences.chinese: 兩星期後莉莉返校，她把這次經歷寫成了日記。

sentences.english: I watched a movie called "Diary of a Wimpy Kid".
sentences.chinese: 我看了一部名叫“小屁孩日記”的電影。

sentences.english: In addition, you can try to write English diaries and even make foreign penpals by writing those.
sentences.chinese: 此外，你可以嘗試用英文寫日記，甚至結交外國筆友。

sentences.english: This diary is interleaved with blotting -paper.
sentences.chinese: 這個日記簿插有吸墨紙。

sentences.english: He prefaced the diaries with a short account of how they were discovered.
sentences.chinese: 他給這本日記寫了序言，簡述日記發現的經過。

sentences.english: He prefaced the diaries with a short account of how they were discovered.
sentences.chinese: 他給這本日記寫了序言，簡述日記發現的經過。

sentences.english: A general journal can be used to record all types of transactions.
sentences.chinese: 普通日記賬可以被用來記錄所有類型的業務。

sentences.english: That woman discovered that her husband peeped into her diary.
sentences.chinese: 那位婦女發現他丈夫偷看她的日記。

sentences.english: The preface of this diary recounted life.
sentences.chinese: 這本日記的勸以佯述了她的生活。

sentences.english: Journaling helps you better understand what your hurdles are.
sentences.chinese: 記日記能幫助你更好的瞭解到自己的障礙在哪裏。

sentences.english: I write down my feelings in a language learning diary.
sentences.chinese: 寫日記，記錄學習英文的感想。

definition: to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
to record/record (written account)/note-taker/record (in sports etc)/CL:個|个[ge4]
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
